value: {'project_name': 'Patikari Hydro Electric Power Project in Distt-Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, India', 'project_summary': 'Patikari Hydro Electric Power Project promoted by Patikari Power Private Limited (PPPL) is a run-of the river scheme utilizing the water of Bakhli Khad, a tributary of river Beas in district Mandi of Himachal Pradesh. Since the project is run-of the river scheme, there has been no requirement for construction of a reservoir for the project. The power house is located on the left bank of Bakhli Khad near village Gudah about 19 kms from Pandoh town with a gross head of 351.80 m for generation of 16 MW of power. The main components of the project comprises of 29 m long Diversion weir with intake chamber, underground desilting tank , feeder tunnel, head race tunnel, power channel as water conductor system, a surge shaft, surface penstock and surface power house to accommodate two generating units of 8 MW capacity each to have a total installed capacity of 16 MW.A 30 day public comment period was held for this project from 16 August to 15 September. No comments were received during the public comment period.', 'project_state_province': 'Himachal Pradesh', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 31.42, 'project_longitude': 77.08}

{'project_name': 'Zhangjiagang Nature Gas Power Generation Project', 'project_summary': 'Zhangjiagang Nature Gas Power Generation Project is to construct a greenfield natural gas fired grid-connected power plant in Zhangjiagang City in East China’s Jiangsu Province, and be invested, constructed and operated by Zhangjiagang Huaxing Power Co., Ltd.The purpose of the proposed project is to construct a new thermal power plant using natural gas as fuel in order to supply electricity to JPG and increase the peak regulation capacity of JPG as well as lead to reduce the green house gas emissions. According to the FSR of the proposed project, the power generation technology is 9F-level gas-steam combined cycle, the rated total installation capacity is 780MW (2×390MW), the annual operation hours is 3500 hours, the annual natural gas consumption is estimated to be 576 million m3, the annual power generation is 2730 GWh and the annual net electricity output sent to the grid is 2675.4GWh.', 'project_state_province': 'Jiangsu Province', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 31.9, 'project_longitude': 120.6}

{'project_name': 'Improved Agricultural Practices for Rice Cultivation in India', 'project_summary': 'This project aims to reduce the CH4 emissions through improved water management practices involving alternate wetting and drying (AWD) of the paddy lands instead of the traditional continuous flooding method. Along with reduced water usage by implementing AWD, the project also aims to improve soil health without any yield penalty.', 'project_state_province': 'Assam and West Bengal', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 24.9, 'project_longitude': 88.1}

{'project_name': 'Maodeng Pasture Improved Grassland Management Project', 'project_summary': 'Maodeng Pasture Improved Grassland Management Project (hereinafter as “the project”) is located in Xilin Hot City, Xilingol League, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, China. The Xilin Hot City geographic coordinates of the project zone are 115 °16′~117°13′E and 43°02′~44°52′N and borders Abaga Banner in the west, Zhenglan Banner in the south, Xiwu Banner and Chifeng City in the east, and Dongwu Banner in the north.
The main objective of the project is to implement sustainable grassland management measures for 10,533.33 hectares of degraded grassland through seeding, grazing prohibition and fertilization. These measures improved grassland productivity, restored vegetation, significantly increased vegetation coverage, improved biodiversity in degraded grasslands, increased the proportion of superior pasture, improved soil fertility, and enhanced the stability of grassland ecosystems.
According to the baseline survey, before the implementation of the project, due to the impact of climate change and human activities, the grassland in this area has been facing varying degrees of degradation, sandification, and sparse vegetation.
The total scale of the project is 10,533.33 hectares. Strictly ban grazing on all plots within the project area for the first five years after the completion of the project and, after five years, adopt sustainable grassland management methods according to the actual grassland restoration situation, such as rotational grazing in different pastoral areas, limits the time and number of grazing in the project area to protect the natural grassland resources, curb the deterioration of the ecological environment of the natural grassland.', 'project_state_province': 'Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 44.22, 'project_longitude': 116.27}
{'organization_name': 'Wuhan Haimingsen Environmental Protection Technology Co., Ltd.', 'state/city': 'Wuhan', 'country': 'China'}

{'project_name': 'Hydroelectric projects at Oibita River', 'project_summary': 'The hydroelectric projects at Obita River considers the installation of two run-of-river renewable small hydroelectric plants, at the rivered of the Oibita River in jurisdiction of the municipalities of Oiba, Guapota, Guadalupe and Chima, Department of Santander, with an effective power rating of 19.9 MW each and a predicted supply of about 273.4 GWh (for both power plants) per year to feed the National Interconnected System of Colombia.', 'project_state_province': 'Bucaramanga city', 'project_country': 'Colombia', 'project_latitude': 6.27, 'project_longitude': -73.34}

{'project_name': 'Wayang Windu Phase 2 Geothermal Power Project', 'project_summary': 'Wayang Windu Phase 2 Geothermal Power Project, is a 117MW geothermal power station, which is an additional power unit to an existing grid-connected renewable power plant. The Project activity is the generation of power using a reliable and renewable resource in place of power generation by a more greenhouse gas intensive fuel/source. The project reduces greenhouse gas emissions through the displacement of fossil fuel electricity generation with a clean, renewable energy source.', 'project_state_province': 'West Java', 'project_country': 'Indonesia', 'project_latitude': -7.21, 'project_longitude': 107.63}

{'project_name': 'Maoshaping Hydro Power Project', 'project_summary': 'The Maoshaping Hydro Power Project is a small-scale run-of-river hydropower project in Yunnan Province, in China. Total installed capacity of the Project will be 7.5 MW, consisting of three 2.5MW turbines. The project will annually generate 40,530 MWh and supply a predicted amount of 40,327 MWh of electricity to the Yangbi County Power Grid, then to the Yunnan Power Grid, finally to the China Southern Power Grid. The purpose of the project is to utilise the hydrological resources of the Yangbi River through construction of a run-of-river hydro project to generate zero emissions electricity for the China Southern Power Grid. The electricity currently generated by the grid is relatively carbon intensive, with an operating margin emission factor of 1.0040 tC.', 'project_state_province': 'Yunnan Province', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 25.67, 'project_longitude': 99.96}

{'project_name': 'Grouped Wind Power Project in India', 'project_summary': 'The project is a grouped project activity that generates renewable electricity from wind power, in India. The generated renewable electricity will displace an equivalent amount of carbon intensive electricity from the Northern, Eastern, Western and Northeastern Grid (NEWNE) as well as the Southern Grid in India. The grouped project will lead to an annual average reduction of 130,195 t CO2e over the crediting period. The grouped projects consist of 68.875 MW grid-connected and 6.025 MW captive renewable electricity generations with an aggregate capacity of 74.9 MW.', 'project_state_province': 'Rajasthan, Gujarat, Karmataka, Tamil Nadu, Ma', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 17.02, 'project_longitude': 74.58}
{'organization_name': 'Gansu Longlin Hydropower Development Co., Ltd', 'state/city': 'Guatemala City'}
{'organization_name': 'Wuhan Haimingsen Environmental Protection Technology Co., Ltd.', 'state/city': 'Wuhan', 'country': 'China'}

{'project_name': "U' Balam'moo A'kalché ó Blue Carbon Mangrove Conservation Project, Conserving Coastal Ecosystems in Campeche to Support Life", 'project_summary': 'In Mexico, the mangrove areas in state of Campeche are significantly impacted by deforestation.  Among the major drivers of the deforestation in the region, it is possible to identify land use changes altering the hydrology of the region, illegal logging, and anthropogenic fires.  According to a study made for the project proponent, the deforestation rate for Laguna de Términos and Petenes is 2.62%/year for the period of 2005-2016.

The Project activity is a REDD+ grouped project that intents to address the unplanned deforestation of wetlands in the state of Campeche. Currently, the grouped project is comprised of 32 project activity instances, 21 in Petenes and 11 in Laguna de Términos.

Until this PD version, the 32 project activity instances are wetland area located inside federally owned, private and ejido lands, across the state of Campeche.  In the future, more project activity instances will be added to this grouped project, being that they will potentially be either in federally/nationally-owned land, private land or in an ejido owned land.

Conservation activities include but are not limited to reestablishing canals, maintaining canal structures, soil rehabilitation, deforestation monitoring, and monitoring of birds and mammals.

The project proponent has been engaging with communities in ejidos and private lands since 2016 under a participatory and inclusive approach and will also include more properties as the project is developed. BlueMX is also conducting capacity building sessions and developing outreach and communication materials to empower communities for jointly conducting the conservation activities.', 'project_state_province': 'Campeche', 'project_country': 'Mexico', 'project_latitude': 19.33, 'project_longitude': -89.94}

{'project_name': 'Shanxi Xiyang CMM Power Generation Project', 'project_summary': 'The purpose of the project is to utilize the extracted CMM with low concentration methane concentration to produce electricity. No coal bed methane (CBM) or ventilation air methane (VAM) utilization is involved. Eleven sets of CMM power generators will be installed with a total installed capacity of 24MW (12*2MW), destroying 42.14 million m3 of methane annually. The expected annual exported electricity will be 163,987 MWh, which will be supplied to the coal mine first through the electricity distribution network in Fenghui coal mine area, and then to North China Power Grid(NCPG) if there is any electricity surplus, replacing the electricity that would otherwise have been purchased from the NCPG and displace part of the electricity generated by NCPG dominated by fossil fuel-fired power plants. The waste heat from the generators will be recovered by waste heat boilers to provide free hot water to the coal mines, which was provided by waste coal fired boilers before the implementation of the Project.', 'project_state_province': 'Shanxi province', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 37.54, 'project_longitude': 113.62}

{'project_name': 'Karakus Hydropower Plant, Turkey', 'project_summary': 'Karakus Hydropower Plant, Turkey owned by Nisan Elektromekanik Enerji San. ve Tic. A.S. is a small scale, run-of-river hydropower project located on the Karakus River, Tokat, Turkey. The main objective of the Project owner is to increase the power generating capacity in Turkey by developing, constructing and operating renewable energy power plants with the support of carbon credits. The Project employs 2 Francis-type turbines with 2.25 MWe capacity each, totalling to 4.5 MW. The estimated net power supply to the grid is 13,110 MWh per annum.', 'project_state_province': 'Tokat', 'project_country': 'Turkey', 'project_latitude': 40.7, 'project_longitude': 37.12}

{'project_name': 'Aeco Peatland Restoration Latvia #1', 'project_summary': 'The project restores a 438 hectares drained grassland fen peatland in Eastern Latvia.', 'project_country': 'Latvia', 'project_latitude': 56.94, 'project_longitude': 26.92}

{'project_name': 'Upgrade of Dominican Power Partners’ Los Mina power station from open cycle to combined cycle power generation', 'project_summary': 'The proposed project includes construction of a Heat Recovery Steam Generators (HRSGs) that will take advantage of the open cycle generation of the existing natural gas based power plant in Los Mina to produce steam, which will in turn be used to power a 108 MW steam turbine. Los Mina power plant currently includes two 105 MW units, with average historical production of 80MW each, due to grid system requirement. The total capacity of the plant will increase from 210 MW to an expected 318 MW. The potential GHG emissions reduction are based on the fact that electricity generated by the project activity using HRSGs will offset electricity from the national grid which is highly fuel oil and open-cycle based. Furthermore, the project enables a higher supply of energy to the local market using the same amount of fuel, enables a better utilization of non-renewable resources, and in turn enables further development of the country, which is currently limited by its energy supply.', 'project_state_province': 'Los Minas Sur', 'project_country': 'Dominican Republic', 'project_latitude': 18.5, 'project_longitude': -69.87}

{'project_name': 'Agropalma REDD+ Project', 'project_summary': 'The Agropalma REDD+ Project is a partnership between Biofílica Ambipar Environment and Agropalma Group and its purpose is to promote forest conservation, maintenance of carbon stocks and mitigation of climate change through the reduction of Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions from land use change. In addition to the climate benefits, the Project also intends to generate social benefits based on sustainable economic development practices and improved well-being of the surrounding communities, as well as environmental benefits through actions aimed at the conservation of local flora and fauna. The Project area covers 50,519 hectares of Amazon forest and is located almost entirely in the northeastern mesoregion of Pará State, including the municipalities of Tailândia, Moju, Tomé Açu and Acará. The region has great relevance in relation to its biodiversity, since it is located in the Belém Center of Endemism (CEB), a place with a large concentration of rare and endemic species. The predominant vegetation is Dense Ombrophylous Forest with a high density of medium and large trees, besides woody lianas and epiphytes.', 'project_state_province': 'Pará', 'project_country': 'Brazil', 'project_latitude': -2.49, 'project_longitude': -48.75}

{'project_name': '12.5 MW Bundled grid-connected wind electricity generation project in Karnataka, India', 'project_summary': 'The project activity under consideration entails generation of clean power by harnessing wind energy – a non-conventional renewable energy resource and export of the electricity generated to the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) and Hubli Electricity Supply Company Limited (HESCOM) on the basis of Power Purchase Agreements. The electricity exported from the project to the grid thereby replaces an equivalent amount of power generation at the grid connected power plants which are primarily fossil fuel based. Therefore the project activity results in an equivalent amount of CO2 emission reduction which otherwise would have resulted from fossil fuel combustion related to electricity generation at the grid. The project activity is a bundled wind energy project with total capacity of 12.5 MW, comprising of Ten Wind Turbine Generators (WTG’s) of varying capacities.', 'project_state_province': 'Karnataka', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 14.96, 'project_longitude': 75.92}
{'organization_name': 'Wind World Wind Resources Development Private Limited'}

{'project_name': 'Greenfield Solar Power Mission by Fortum India', 'project_summary': 'The main purpose of this project activity is to generate clean form of electricity through renewable solar energy source. Fortum Solar Plus Private Limited is the promoter of the project activity. The project activity involves installation of 250 MW solar power project. The project will replace average anthropogenic emissions of greenhouse gases (GHG’s) estimated to be approximately 434,238 tCO2e per year total GHG emission reductions for the chosen 10 year crediting period will be 4,776,726 tonnes of CO2e.  PUBLIC COMMENT PERIOD: This project was open for public comment from 29 November – 29 December 2019. No public comments were received.', 'project_state_province': 'Rajasthan state', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 26.67, 'project_longitude': 71.54}

{'project_name': '18 MW Kemphole Mini Hydel Scheme (KMHS), by International Power Corporation Limited, India', 'project_summary': 'Kemphole Mini Hydel Scheme (KMHS) is an 18 MW (3 X 6 MW) Run-of-the-River hydro power project located at Kemphole stream in Hassan district of Karnataka in India. The main activity of the project is generation of electricity using hydro potential available in Kemphole stream and exporting the generated power national grid.   The project location is situated in dense forests of the Kemphole reserve forest and there is no habitation in the nearby area. The project does not involve any displacement of local population and associated rehabilitations. The project uses horizontal Francis turbines for power generation.', 'project_state_province': 'Karnataka', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 12.84, 'project_longitude': 75.67}
{'organization_name': 'West Henan Xinhua Irrigation and Hydroelectricity', 'state/city': 'Florida', 'country': 'United States'}

{'project_name': 'Huaneng Tuokexun Baiyanghe Third Stage 49.5MW Wind Farm Project', 'project_summary': 'Huaneng Tuokexun Baiyanghe Third Stage 49.5MW Wind Farm Project (hereinafter referred as the proposed project) is developed by Huaneng Tulufan Wind Power Generation Co.,Ltd. It is located at 33km North of Tuokexun County, 49km Northwest of Tulufan City, in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, Northwest China. The proposed project involves the installation of 33 turbines, each of which has a rated output of 1,500 kW, providing a total installed capacity of 49.5 MW1. The annual output of the proposed project to Northwest China Power Grid (NWPG) is estimated to be 102,540 MWh2 after the operation. The estimated annual GHG emission reductions are 94,121 tCO2e.PUBLIC COMMENT PERIOD:This project was open for public comment from 21 November – 21 December 2019. No public comments were received.', 'project_state_province': 'Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 43.08, 'project_longitude': 88.6}

{'project_name': 'Matebe Hydroelectric plant', 'project_summary': 'The purpose of the project is to install and operate a run-of-river, greenfield, 13.41 MW hydroelectric plant at Matebe (the “project”) and related distribution network in North Kivu, in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). The project site is located near Virunga National Park, approximately 80km north of the main city of Goma.  This project was open for public comment from 25 September - 24 October 2017. No comments were received.', 'project_state_province': 'North Kivu', 'project_country': 'Congo, Dem. Rep', 'project_latitude': -1.2, 'project_longitude': 29.47}

{'project_name': '49.5 MW Wind Power Project by FFCEL in Pakistan', 'project_summary': 'FFCEL Wind Power project is located in Jhimpir, District Thatta, Sindh. Total installed capacity of the project is 49.5 MW consisting of 33 number of Nordex S77 1.5 MW wind turbines. It is Pakistan’s first grid connected wind power project to achieve Commercial Operations. This historic milestone was achieved on May 16, 2013. The project activity is expected to generate 143.6 GWh per annum from wind energy. It is country’s signature project and a major step forwrad towards achievement of self-sufficiency in energy production through renewable and indigenous resources.', 'project_state_province': 'Sindh', 'project_country': 'Pakistan', 'project_latitude': 25.05, 'project_longitude': 68.01}

{'project_name': 'Alto Maipo Hydroelectric Project', 'project_summary': 'Alto Maipo Hydroelectric Project (PHAM) is a Greenfield electricity generation project activity to be developed by Alto Maipo SpA, consisting of two run-of-the-river hydroelectric power stations, “Alfalfal II” (264 MW) and “Las Lajas“ (267 MW).   PHAM´s run-of-river power stations will be connected to the Interconnected Central System (SIC2) grid through independent electric transmission lines. The project’s clean energy will be delivered to the SIC, diversifying the energy pool through the implementation of renewable energy sources; contributing to reduce the dependence of the Chilean electricity system from imported fossil fuel, and therefore the project will reduce Green House Gas (GHG) emissions, and improve the availability and reliability of the electricity supply.', 'project_country': 'Chile', 'project_latitude': -33.56, 'project_longitude': -70.29}

{'project_name': 'Ruijing Geothermal Based Space Heating System', 'project_summary': 'The project can supply geothermal heat to 7,989.6 thousand m2 of newly built residential buildings with a total heating load of 399.48 MW. The scenario prior to the implementation of the proposed project activity is that heat supplied to the building areas in winter would be provided by isolated coal-fired boilers. Emission reduction credits will be earned using geothermal energy instead of the combustion of fossil fuel for space heating. The annual average CO2 emission reductions are estimated as 436,722 tCO2e, and total GHG emission reductions for the first crediting period are 4,367,220 tCO2e.', 'project_state_province': 'Henan Province', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 33.88, 'project_longitude': 115.49}

{'project_name': 'Agroforestry plantation Bateke Plateaus', 'project_summary': 'This savannah Land Afforestation Project on the Batéké Plateaus north of Brazzaville aims to develop an alternative and renewable source of wood for urban use, based on the establishment of forest plantations adapted to these needs. These plantations will be set up in anthropogenic savannahs, i.e. land with a biomass stock blocked at a very low stage due to recurrent bushfires. The savannahs are deliberately fired at frequent intervals (at least once a year) by villagers to facilitate agricultural, pastoral and cynegetic
activities.
The production of wood will be provided by the plantations of Acacia auriculoformis. The coal transformation
will be carried out using improved traditional carbonization techniques. The bags of coal produced will then
be transported to Brazzaville and will mainly supply the local industry.
The Acacia rows will be intercropped with lines of food crops, forming agroforestry plantations. Food crops will be managed by local communities and will ensure self-sustainability while supplying the local food chain.', 'project_state_province': 'Republic of Congo', 'project_country': 'Congo, Rep.', 'project_latitude': -3.9, 'project_longitude': 15.56}

{'project_name': 'Denizli Bundled Solar Project', 'project_summary': 'The proposed project activity involves the installation of 5 unlicensed Solar Power Projects. The total installed capacity of the project is 6.760 MW; which involves operation of solar projects in different fields in Denizli province of Turkey that is fed into the Turkish grid.The purpose of the project activity is to generate energy electricity by the utilization of solar power and further selling the generated energy to the respective Grid. In this process there is no consumption of any fossil fuel and hence it does not lead to any greenhouse gas emissions. Thus, electricity would be generated through sustainable means without causing any negative impact on the environment. The estimated annual average GHG emission reductions from the project activity will be 6,818 tonnes of CO2e and total GHG emission reductions for the chosen 10 year crediting period will be 68,180 tonnes of CO2e. The crediting period is renewable for a maximum of 2 times.', 'project_state_province': 'Acıpayam state in Denizli province', 'project_country': 'Turkey', 'project_latitude': 37.41, 'project_longitude': 29.44}

{'project_name': 'Adani Enterprises Limited Solar PV Power Project in Gujarat, India', 'project_summary': 'Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) has implemented a Photovoltaic (PV) based solar power project of capacity 40 MWp. The project activity consists of amorphous Silicon thin film modules of 100/95 Wp capacity. The project is located in Village Bitta, District Kutch in the State of Gujarat. The project activity will generate electricity from solar resource that will be fed to the North-East-West-North-East (NEWNE) grid of India.', 'project_state_province': 'Gujarat', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 23.26, 'project_longitude': 69.02}

{'project_name': 'Basak Hydropower Plant, Turkey', 'project_summary': 'The objective of the proposed project Basak Hydropower Plant, Turkey which is developed by Nisan Elektromekanik Enerji San. ve Tic. A.S., is to produce electricity through a run-of-river hydropower station located across the borders of Bartin and Kastamonu Provinces, which lays in the highest earthquake zone 1. Proposed Basak Diversion Weir and HEPP are located in the Kurucaþile county of Bartýn Province in the Blacksea Region. The Project Area is located on 10 km southeast from Kurucaþile town which is at the 60 km northeast of the Bartýn. The diversion weir structure will be built on Kapisuyu stream. The power house is situated at the south of the Bartýn-Inebolu highway. Basak Hydropower Plant, Turkey comprises the implementation of a run-of-river hydropower plant with a total installed mechanical capacity of 6.85 MW consisting of three Francis turbines which are connected to power generators. The project’s electricity generation is estimated as 20,350 MWh.', 'project_state_province': 'Black Sea region', 'project_country': 'Turkey', 'project_latitude': 41.84, 'project_longitude': 32.75}

{'project_name': 'Biomass Based Steam Generation Project by Industrial Progressive India Limited', 'project_summary': 'Industrial Progressive India Limited has a milk processing plant situated at Village - Agwanpur, Dist Palwal (Haryana), having processing capacity of maximum 6 lakh litre per day. There milk product profile includes Acid Casein, Whey Powder (Demineralised), Skimmed milk Powder, Dairy Whitener, Ghee (Butter fat).  They need steam for milk processing which was earlier generated using coal fuelled boiler. Project activity involve installation of new biomass (rice husk) based boiler having capacity of 15 TPH at 17.5 kg/cm2 pressure to generate steam.', 'project_state_province': 'State: Haryana', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 28.17, 'project_longitude': 77.32}

{'project_name': '21.8 MW Wind Power Project at Jangi Vandhiya, Gujarat by Powerica Limited', 'project_summary': 'The project activity involves installation and operation of 11 WTGs of 2.0 MW comprising a total capacity of 22.0 MW. The project activity will utilise V100 model of WTGs supplied of Vestas. The detailed specifications for the WTGs have been presented in section A.3. All the WTGs involved in the project are planned to be commissioned at Bhachau Taluka of Kutch district of Gujarat. The project aims at providing electricity to the state of Gujarat by effective utilization of renewable resources. The electricity generated from the project activity would be supplied to NEWNE regional grid of India. Powerica Limited will be developing this project keeping in consideration of the funding available under the Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) of the United Nations  Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). This is because the project activity qualifies as a CDM project as it would be feeding clean power to the electricity grid (North-EastWest-North East or NEWNE grid, India)  PUBLIC COMMENT PERIOD: This project was open for public comment from 19 November  –  19 December 2018.  No comments were received', 'project_state_province': 'Gujarat', 'project_country': 'India', 'project_latitude': 23.21, 'project_longitude': 70.57}

{'project_name': 'Qinghai Afforestation Project', 'project_summary': 'The Qinghai Afforestation Project (hereafter “the project”) is located in Xining City, Qinghai Province of China, whose aim is to increase carbon sequestration and contribute to local sustainable development by planting trees on the barren or degraded lands. The project proponent is Qinghai Forestry Ecological Construction and Investment Co., Ltd. 13,862.40ha (207,936.00 Mu) of forest has beenplanted by direct planting on degraded lands in Xining City, including 2 counties: Huangzhong County and Huangyuan County. All the project sites were previously degraded grassland and barren land. There is no natural renewal and reforestation before the project. The implementation of the project would generate GHG emission removals and improve local environment through growing of the trees, increase income of local residents by offering job opportunities from the project, enhance the capabilities of local communities and residents by providing their relevant technical skills and training, and increase local biodiversity as a result of establishing a forest of native trees (Picea crassifolia, Sabina przewalskii, Pinus tabulaeformis, Populus, Betula). The project is estimated to generate GHG emission removals of 76,694,815tCO2e in 100 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 766,948tCO2e.', 'project_state_province': 'Qinghai', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 36.45, 'project_longitude': 101.12}

{'project_name': '23.80 MW KIY Regulator and Hydroelectric Power Plant Project', 'project_summary': 'The KIY Regulator and Hydroelectric Power Plant Project  developed by KIY Enerji A.Þ. is a grid conncected electricity generation from renewable sources project , a hydropower plant (HEPP) with a run of river regulator in Adana.', 'project_state_province': 'Adana province', 'project_country': 'Turkey', 'project_latitude': 37.74, 'project_longitude': 35.71}

{'project_name': 'Kenya Agricultural Carbon Project', 'project_summary': 'The project promotes and implements a package of Sustainable Agricultural Land Management (SALM) practices within smallholder farming systems and generates GHG removals through soil and tree carbon sequestration.', 'project_state_province': 'Nyanza and Western provinces', 'project_country': 'Kenya', 'project_latitude': 0.13, 'project_longitude': 34.39}

{'project_name': 'OKI REDD+ Project', 'project_summary': "The Project consists of forest protection activities, including emission reduction in the mangrove forests of about 11,650 ha (REDD), and afforestation activities of about 11,840 ha on bare land and grassland (ARR) in a protected forest of about 23,500 ha in Organ Komering Irir, South Sumatra, Indonesia.
The main ecosystems of these two regions are mangrove forests and grassland, bare land and shrub land, respectively, which are separated by boundaries.
Mangrove forest in the region has been severely affected by forest deforestation caused by the conversion to shrimp ponds since the beginning of 1990’s. Mangrove forest in this region had decreased by about 540 ha (9787 ha to 9248 ha) from 1990 to 2012, while bare land area had increased by about 1200 ha (450 ha to 1685 ha). 
In this project area, the impacts of construction of artificial waterways to transport materials necessary for activities in adjacent industrial forests, the spread of fire due to fire outside the project area, and the development due to misidentification of unclear boundary line with outside the project area can be seen. In mangrove forest areas in particular, there has been a large number of small-scale activities for the development of shrimp aquaculture ponds and the logging for that, and these activities are a major cause of deforestation in this area.
This is evident from field surveys, satellite image analysis and interviews. This trend is also gradually expanding in the areas adjacent to the project area, and if the situation continues, the deforestation of the protected forests is likely to continue. Originally, the project area is a protected forest, and cutting down for shrimp farming is prohibited, but in this area, it has been conventionally carried out for livelihood, and the law is not generally observed.
The project will reduce CO2 emissions by taking appropriate preventive measures for drivers and curbing the progress of deforestation. In addition, where there is an old aquaculture pond, the silvo fishery method will be used to plant trees while preventing leakage.
The purpose of this project is to prevent further deforestation by providing local people with alternative means to support the lives of them such as opportunities for participation and cooperation in forest conservation and afforestation projects. Therefore, as a result of communication with local residents focusing on the sustainable development of the local society for many years before the start of the project, a deep relationship of trust has been built, and participation and cooperation in the project by them have been actively carried out. These include the organization of farmers' groups, forest patrols and afforestation activities.
 The monitoring of carbon storage is carried out by the combination of satellite image analysis and field measurement (ground truth). Landsat images are used to classify land cover. Field measurements are also made to identify the actual vegetation and to obtain data to estimate the carbon factor of the forest in the project area. It is estimated to contribute to an annual reduction of approximately 57,000 tons of CO2 emissions. On the other hand, the amount of CO2 absorbed by afforestation activities is estimated to be at an average of about 180,000 tons per year from 2022.
After registering with the Verra, we will use the funds from the credit sales to maintain the project and return the funds to local residents through the construction of schools and other facilities and the provision of educational and employment opportunities, thereby contributing to the creation of a sustainable local community.", 'project_state_province': 'South Sumatera province', 'project_country': 'Indonesia', 'project_latitude': -2.56, 'project_longitude': 105.6}

{'project_name': 'Alter Biogas ll Project', 'project_summary': 'WABIO Technology Holding Ltd. builds and operates its own biogas power plants for third-party companies wishing to gain access to renewable energy sources. Alter Biogas ll Project is one of those projects, which will be located on cadastral parcel no. 2906/11 in cadastral municipality of Nova Crnja, Serbia. Prior to the development of this Alter Biogas ll Project, the manure and straw from the farms is stored in open manure lagoons where it is allowed to decay anaerobically, generating greenhouse gas emissions and other negative impacts on the farm environment through soil pollution. Alter Biogas ll Project will use cow manure and corn straw as feedstock for anaerobic digestion and production of biogas. Electricity will be generated from the 999 kWe generator within the plant.', 'project_country': 'Serbia', 'project_latitude': 45.68, 'project_longitude': 20.62}

{'project_name': 'Gannan Improved Agricultural Land Management Project', 'project_summary': 'The project is aimed at changing the original agricultural operation activities (conventional cultivation) into the improved agricultural practices, which include no-tillage, reduced synthetic fertilizer application, organic fertilizer application and straw returning in the farmland of Gannan County, Heilongjiang Province, China. A total of 80,000 ha of farmland has been managed under the improved agricultural practices. The project is estimated to generate GHG emission removals of 5,781,320 tCO2e from 15-Nov-2020 to 14-Nov-2040, with an average annual GHG emission removals of 289,066 tCO2e.', 'project_state_province': 'Heilongjiang', 'project_country': 'China', 'project_latitude': 47.9, 'project_longitude': 124.2}
